sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: What are the products of the reaction between hydrochloric acid and magnesium oxide? Write a balanced chemical equation for the reaction and identify the type of reaction based on the chemical equation.
message_2:
When hydrochloric acid (HCl) reacts with magnesium oxide (MgO), the products formed are magnesium chloride (MgCl₂) and water (H₂O). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

MgO + 2HCl → MgCl₂ + H₂O

This reaction is an example of an acid-base reaction, specifically a neutralization reaction, where an acid reacts with a base to produce a salt and water.
